Member Enumeration Documentation

enum gaia::core::ApplicationInfo::APP_FLAG_MASK

Application flags.

Enumerator:
FLAG_SYSTEM 

Value for getFlagMask: if set, this application is installed in the device's system image.

FLAG_DEBUGGABLE 

Value for getFlagMask: set to true if this application would like to allow debugging of its code, even when installed on a non-development system.

FLAG_HAS_CODE 

Value for getFlagMask: set to true if this application has code associated with it.

FLAG_PERSISTENT 

Value for getFlagMask: set to true if this application is persistent.

FLAG_FACTORY_TEST 

Value for getFlagMask: set to true if this application holds the FACTORY_TEST permission and the device is running in factory test mode.

FLAG_ALLOW_TASK_REPARENTING 

Value for getFlagMask: default value for the corresponding PageInfo flag.

FLAG_ALLOW_CLEAR_USER_DATA 

Value for getFlagMask: default value for the corresponding PageInfo flag.

FLAG_UPDATED_SYSTEM_APP 

Value for getFlagMask: this is set if this application has been install as an update to a built-in system application.

FLAG_TEST_ONLY 

Value for getFlagMask: this is set of the application has specified.

FLAG_SUPPORTS_SMALL_SCREENS 

Value for getFlagMask: true when the application's window can be reduced in size for smaller screens.

FLAG_SUPPORTS_NORMAL_SCREENS 

Value for getFlagMask: true when the application's window can be displayed on normal screens.

FLAG_SUPPORTS_LARGE_SCREENS 

Value for getFlagMask: true when the application's window can be increased in size for larger screens.

FLAG_RESIZEABLE_FOR_SCREENS 

Value for getFlagMask: true when the application knows how to adjust its UI for different screen sizes.

FLAG_SUPPORTS_SCREEN_DENSITIES 

Value for getFlagMask: true when the application knows how to accomodate different screen densities.

FLAG_VM_SAFE_MODE 

Value for getFlagMask: set to true if this application would like to request the VM to operate under the safe mode.

FLAG_ALLOW_BACKUP 

Value for getFlagMask: set to false if the application does not wish to permit any OS-driven backups of its data; true otherwise.

FLAG_KILL_AFTER_RESTORE 

Value for getFlagMask: set to false if the application must be kept in memory following a full-system restore operation; true otherwise.

FLAG_RESTORE_ANY_VERSION 

Value for getFlagMask: Set to true if the application's backup agent claims to be able to handle restore data even "from the future," i.e.

from versions of the application with a versionCode greater than the one currently installed on the device. Use with caution! By default this attribute is false and the Backup Manager will ensure that data from "future" versions of the application are never supplied during a restore operation.

FLAG_EXTERNAL_STORAGE 

Value for getFlagMask: Set to true if the application is currently installed on external/removable/unprotected storage.

Such applications may not be available if their storage is not currently mounted. When the storage it is on is not available, it will look like the application has been uninstalled (its .pkg or .apk is no longer available) but its persistent data is not removed.

FLAG_STOPPED 

Value for getFlagMask: true if this application's package is in the stopped state.

FLAG_FORWARD_LOCK 

Value for getFlagMask: Set to true if the application has been installed using the forward lock option.

Create a new instance of the Parcelable class.

Parameters:
inThe Parcel to read the object's data from.
Returns:
Returns a new instance of the Parcelable class. And ApplicationInfo pointer need to be released after used.
int32_t gaia::core::ApplicationInfo::getDescriptionRes ( ) const

A style resource identifier (in the package's resources) of the description of an application.

From the "description" attribute or, if not set, 0.

Returns:
Return resource ideneifier of the description of application.
int32_t gaia::core::ApplicationInfo::getFlagMask ( ) const

Flags mask associated with the application.

Any combination of

See also:
FLAG_ALLOW_BACKUP, FLAG_ALLOW_CLEAR_USER_DATA, FLAG_ALLOW_TASK_REPARENTING, FLAG_DEBUGGABLE, FLAG_EXTERNAL_STORAGE, FLAG_FACTORY_TEST, FLAG_HAS_CODE, FLAG_KILL_AFTER_RESTORE, FLAG_PERSISTENT, FLAG_RESIZEABLE_FOR_SCREENS, FLAG_RESTORE_ANY_VERSION, FLAG_SUPPORTS_LARGE_SCREENS, FLAG_SUPPORTS_NORMAL_SCREENS, FLAG_SUPPORTS_SCREEN_DENSITIES, FLAG_SUPPORTS_SMALL_SCREENS, FLAG_SYSTEM, FLAG_TEST_ONLY, FLAG_UPDATED_SYSTEM_APP, FLAG_VM_SAFE_MODE
Returns:
Return the flag mask.

base::String gaia::core::ApplicationInfo::getProcessName ( ) const

The name of the process this application should run in.

From the "process" attribute or, if not set, the same as package name.

Returns:
Return the process name of the application.
base::String gaia::core::ApplicationInfo::getSourceDir ( ) const

Get the full path to the location of this package.

Returns:
Return the full source dir of package.
int32_t gaia::core::ApplicationInfo::getTargetSdkVersion ( ) const

The minimum SDK version this application targets.

It may run on earilier versions, but it knows how to work with any new behavior added at this version. You should compare that this number is >= the SDK version number at which your behavior was introduced.

Returns:
Return the target sdk version.
int32_t gaia::core::ApplicationInfo::getTheme ( ) const

A style resource identifier (in the package's resources) of the default visual theme of the application.

From the "theme" attribute or, if not set, 0.

Returns:
Return resource identifier of the theme.
int32_t gaia::core::ApplicationInfo::getUid ( ) const

Get the kernel user-ID that has been assigned to this application; currently this is not a unique ID (multiple applications can have the same uid).

base::String gaia::core::ApplicationInfo::loadDescription ( const PackageManager &  pm) const

Retrieve the textual description of the application.

This will call back on the given PackageManager to load the description from the application.

Parameters:
pmA PackageManager from which the label can be loaded; usually the PackageManager from which you originally retrieved this item.
Returns:
Returns a String containing the application's description. If there is no description, empty is returned.

int32_t  flags 
)

Parameters:

flagsAdditional flags about how the object should be written. May be 0.
